intro: Silene vulgaris subsp. vourinensis, commonly known as the Vourin's campion, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
